page.title: 12Steeple Aston
page.content: There is no doctor's surgery or clinic. Most people are registered with the doctors at Deddington Health Centre to which a minibus service operates twice weekly. The area is within the Oxfordshire Area Health Authority. Home helps give assistance to sick or disabled people in their own homes. A meals on wheels service is provided for the sick and disabled on a twice weekly basis. Most of the children attend Steeple Aston Dr. Radcliffe's C.E. Primary School (130) pupils. This school is able to draw on funds from the Dr. Radcliffe Trust. There is a playgroup for younger children. Buses take older children to the Warriner School in Bloxham.
